intro: Betencourtia gracillima, commonly known as the slender betencourtia, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to cool, dry climates. Betencourtia gracillima is often found in alpine meadows and is known for its delicate, upright growth habit. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its natural habitat.
